image.altText: An older woman with short white hair sits in a living room looking serious.

props.synopsis: From today Canberrans like Gail Ford will be able to apply for the ACT's new voluntary assisted dying scheme, which its advocates say gives dignity in death to applicants.

title.children: Gail wants the choice to 'die with dignity'. From today she can

image.altText: Disability car parks are behind fences with with no access signs on them.

props.synopsis: Patients with mobility issues are struggling to visit medical professionals after the Theatre Lane car park closed for the construction of the Lyric Theatre.

title.children: Disability parking closure leaves Canberra patients searching for options

image.altText: A koala holds onto a tree branch while looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A hidden group of koalas is found for the first time in a remote area of the New South Wales Snowy Mountains.

title.children: 'Incredibly exciting': Thermal drones detect hidden koala cluster

image.altText: Leanne Castley in the Legislative Assembly.

props.synopsis: After suspending two backbenchers from her party room this week, Canberra Liberals leader Leanne Castley has been silent. And it's hard to see how staying silent is helping Canberrans build trust in her party and her as the ACT's alternative chief minister.

title.children: Silence from Canberra Liberals leader only making a bad situation worse

image.altText: A football player with long dark hair wearing a green jersey, surrounded by players from another team, looks over his shoulder.

props.synopsis: Charges against Canberra Raiders prop Josh Papalii have been permanently stayed after it was revealed police had been discussing the case in a group chat on encrypted messaging service Signal.

title.children: Police group chat stops case against Canberra Raiders star Josh Papalii

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: After a severe car accident, the victim spent a year recovering in hospital. Then one day he discovered his bank account was empty.

title.children: Man sentenced after emptying quadriplegic friend's bank account

image.altText: An older couple, smiling, sitting on a couch, with arms around one another.

props.synopsis: Specialised accommodation will be built in Curtin to house those living with the nation's deadliest disease.

title.children: Canberra is a step closer to getting its first dementia care village

image.altText: An A-frame sign that reads "auction today", directing toward a house.

props.synopsis: The nation has not yet embraced the idea that housing needs to be more affordable, or that it's the most important economic and social issue facing the country.

title.children: What you need to know about why house prices aren't coming down

image.altText: A woman wearing a dark suit, white blouse and dark glasses leaves court.

props.synopsis: A Perth mother who stabbed her daughter's teenage boyfriend when she found him semi-naked in the family home avoids a prison sentence.

title.children: Mother who stabbed daughter's secret boyfriend avoids jail

image.altText: A bathroom with black and white marble throughout with a toilet next to a window with a chandelier over it

props.synopsis: The US president says the new look is more appropriate than the "Art Deco green tile style" from the last renovation in the 1940s.

title.children: Trump renovates White House bathroom with marble and chandelier over toilet

image.altText: A woman and a man walk through glass doors, leaving a building

props.synopsis: A girl who died, allegedly as a result of criminal neglect by her mother, had resorted to eating food out of bins at her school, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm.

title.children: Alleged manslaughter victim resorted to eating from school bins, court told

image.altText: A man with an eyebrow piercing and moustache

props.synopsis: Thousands of pages of evidence had to be reissued to defence team after it was lost in server crash.

title.children: Pheobe Bishop murder accused's case delayed due to server crash

image.altText: Dead pink fish floating in an open ocean fish pen.

props.synopsis: The state's environment watchdog has released a debrief of lessons and reflections from a mass salmon mortality event in which dead fish washed up on Tasmanian beaches.

title.children: Environment regulator releases report on mass salmon deaths

image.altText: A train stops next to a platform while man in a hazmat suit walks alongside it

props.synopsis: British police are not treating a mass stabbing attack on a London-bound train as an act of terror. It left at least 11 people in hospital, some in critical condition.

title.children: Police say British man only suspect in train attack, praise 'heroic' staff

image.altText: A tradie buying and renovating homes at a home inspection.

props.synopsis: Australia's property market is heating up again, with record auctions over spring, and the return of both first home buyers and investors pushing up house prices.

title.children: First-time buyers turning to cheaper investments

image.altText: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor in a black suit and tie wearing military medals, standing alongside a UK policeman and royal guard

props.synopsis: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor will be stripped of his last remaining military position as part of King Charles's decision to remove him from public life, according to the UK defence minister.

title.children: Former Prince Andrew to be stripped of UK military rank

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired woman in sportswear waves as she stands holding a large trophy.

props.synopsis: Australia's last women's singles grand slam champ is encouraged by the new crop of kids coming through, but has urged fans to remain patient with their progress.

title.children: Barty's plea to Aussie fans over progress of young women's stars

image.altText: a large hailstone being measured

props.synopsis: Hailstones of up to 8 and 9 centimetres hit parts of Queensland over the weekend. What caused them to be so large?

title.children: Giant hail hit Queensland causing injuries and damage – why?

image.altText: People walking past a Westpac sign.

props.synopsis: A strong result from Amazon pushes Wall Street high, and the ASX dips as Westpac kicks off bank reporting. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Westpac sells off RAMS home loan business as profit dips

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Jobs market softens, inflation rises ahead of RBA decision
Chinese manufacturing slows but still expanding
Smokes and errors: How illicit tobacco is clouding economic data

image.altText: woman waves on zoom call while breastfeeding her baby

props.synopsis: There are many ways to combine breastfeeding and paid work, for example expressing milk, breastfeeding during breaks, or working from home. Knowing your rights can help you feel more confident when negotiating what that looks like.

title.children: Breastfeeding at work is protected, but it's up to mothers to negotiate it

image.altText: A jockey looks to his right and smiles as he rides his horse towards the line in the Melbourne Cup.

props.synopsis: From quiet beginnings, an unknown English filly came Down Under and changed Australia's racing history by achieving the impossible. This is how Makybe Diva won a historic third Melbourne Cup, 20 years ago.

title.children: 'A champion becomes a legend': Makybe Diva's 'impossible' third Cup win

image.altText: A woman pointing a hose with water coming out of it in to the air as she looks up.

props.synopsis: Communities on prepaid power meters face regular disconnections amid 40 degree-plus heat, meaning no aircon, food rotting in the fridge and long, hot walks to get reconnected.

title.children: Constant power denied to 65,000 customers forced to pay upfront or disconnect

image.altText: cloud over mountain

props.synopsis: About 50,000 people climb Bluff Knoll in WA's Stirling Range each year, and emergency services say they are being called to more rescues as hikers underestimate the challenging track.

title.children: More hikers getting stuck on popular trail as social media draws tourists

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The father of murdered childcare worker Molly Ticehurst breaks down while expressing his frustration at the delays in the case against her alleged killer.

title.children: Court delays bring 'sadness and heartache' to Molly Ticehurst's family

image.altText: A black-and-white map showing the village of Kholm in Afghanistan's north.

props.synopsis: It is unclear how many people have died following an earthquake in northern Afghanistan, two months after a tremor killed more than 2,200 people.

title.children: Magnitude-6.3 earthquake hits Afghanistan

image.altText: PROXY 1 River Region Early Education

props.synopsis: Daycare droughts are all too common in regional Australia, but in one New South Wales town, the shortage is so acute, the community is cracking.

title.children: 'Families in tears' as daycare drought keeps workers out of jobs

image.altText: A dimly lit pokies room with bright colourful lights coming from each of the machines.

props.synopsis: There are calls for football teams to distance themselves from poker machines after data found more than $110 million was lost at venues owned by football clubs and leagues in the last financial year.

title.children: Each day, these football-owned poker machines rake in more than $300k

image.altText: A shadowed figure behind a fence.

props.synopsis: As incarceration rates continue to soar in the Northern Territory, experts say mental health reform in the justice system is crucial for improving community safety in the long term.

title.children: Doctors warn mental health reforms needed to keep children out of prison

image.altText: A man who died

props.synopsis: The death of a Brisbane man after a storm shone a spotlight on the dangers of overhead powerlines in a storm-prone state.

title.children: A good citizen tried helping after a storm. Then a powerline killed him

image.altText: Saraid Taylor of the Demons looks on during the AFLW round two match

props.synopsis: North Melbourne may be undefeated for the second home and away season in a row, but a star Melbourne player says the short AFLW season means they haven't proven themselves against everyone.

title.children: Dees defender says Roos 'haven't proven themselves' against every team

image.altText: In a warehouse space, red lights, shaped like inverted crosses, hang from the ceiling, above candlelit tables, where people eat.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's provocative midwinter festival Dark Mofo will return in 2026, as this year's festival reports fewer interstate visitors as "budgets are tightening" across the country.

title.children: Interstate visitors down but local attendance up at this year's Dark Mofo

image.altText: Snowy mountain landscape with a glacier between two rocky peaks under an overcast sky.

props.synopsis: The avalanche struck the German climbers as they headed for the summit of Cima Vertana about 4pm on Saturday at an altitude of more than 3,500 metres.

title.children: Father and daughter among five killed in Italian Alps avalanche

image.altText: A street with cars parked diagonally on the sides.

props.synopsis: A $500 million accommodation plan in the Pilbara gets the green light from the regional Development Assessment Panel and will now go to the Town of Port Hedland for approval.

title.children: Plan for 1,300-room worker accommodation in WA heads to final stage of approval

image.altText: An armed guard standing outside the glass entrance to the Louvre.

props.synopsis: Four thieves raided the world's most-visited art museum last month, in broad daylight, taking just seven minutes to steal jewellery worth an estimated $150 million before fleeing on scooters.

title.children: Louvre heist suspects believed to be small-time criminals
